022package com.restfb.util;
023
024import static java.lang.String.format;
025import static java.util.Collections.synchronizedMap;
026import static java.util.Collections.unmodifiableList;
027
028import java.lang.annotation.Annotation;
029import java.lang.reflect.*;
030import java.util.*;
031
032import com.restfb.exception.FacebookJsonMappingException;
033
034/**
035 * A collection of reflection-related utility methods.
036 * 
037 * @author <a href="http://restfb.com">Mark Allen</a>
038 * @author Igor Kabiljo
039 * @author Scott Hernandez
040 * @since 1.6
041 */
042public final class ReflectionUtils {
043  /**
044   * In-memory shared cache of reflection data for {@link #findFieldsWithAnnotation(Class, Class)}.
045   */
046  private static final Map<ClassAnnotationCacheKey, List<?>> FIELDS_WITH_ANNOTATION_CACHE =
047      synchronizedMap(new HashMap<>());
048
049  /**
050   * In-memory shared cache of reflection data for {@link #findMethodsWithAnnotation(Class, Class)}.
051   */
052  private static final Map<ClassAnnotationCacheKey, List<Method>> METHODS_WITH_ANNOTATION_CACHE =
053      synchronizedMap(new HashMap<>());
054
055  /**
056   * Prevents instantiation.
057   */
058  private ReflectionUtils() {
059    // prevent instantiation
060  }
061
062  /**
063   * Is the given {@code object} a primitive type or wrapper for a primitive type?
064   * 
065   * @param object
066   *          The object to check for primitive-ness.
067   * @return {@code true} if {@code object} is a primitive type or wrapper for a primitive type, {@code false}
068   *         otherwise.
069   */
070  public static boolean isPrimitive(Object object) {
071    if (object == null) {
072      return false;
073    }
074
075    Class<?> type = object.getClass();
076
077    return object instanceof String //
078        || (object instanceof Integer || Integer.TYPE.equals(type)) //
079        || (object instanceof Boolean || Boolean.TYPE.equals(type)) //
080        || (object instanceof Long || Long.TYPE.equals(type)) //
081        || (object instanceof Double || Double.TYPE.equals(type)) //
082        || (object instanceof Float || Float.TYPE.equals(type)) //
083        || (object instanceof Byte || Byte.TYPE.equals(type)) //
084        || (object instanceof Short || Short.TYPE.equals(type)) //
085        || (object instanceof Character || Character.TYPE.equals(type));
086  }
087
088  /**
089   * Finds fields on the given {@code type} and all of its superclasses annotated with annotations of type
090   * {@code annotationType}.
091   * 
092   * @param <T>
093   *          The annotation type.
094   * @param type
095   *          The target type token.
096   * @param annotationType
097   *          The annotation type token.
098   * @return A list of field/annotation pairs.
099   */
100  public static <T extends Annotation> List<FieldWithAnnotation<T>> findFieldsWithAnnotation(Class<?> type,
101      Class<T> annotationType) {
102    ClassAnnotationCacheKey cacheKey = new ClassAnnotationCacheKey(type, annotationType);
103
104    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
105    List<FieldWithAnnotation<T>> cachedResults =
106        (List<FieldWithAnnotation<T>>) FIELDS_WITH_ANNOTATION_CACHE.get(cacheKey);
107
108    if (cachedResults != null) {
109      return cachedResults;
110    }
111
112    List<FieldWithAnnotation<T>> fieldsWithAnnotation = new ArrayList<>();
113
114    // Walk all superclasses looking for annotated fields until we hit Object
115    while (!Object.class.equals(type) && type != null) {
116      for (Field field : type.getDeclaredFields()) {
117        T annotation = field.getAnnotation(annotationType);
118        if (annotation != null) {
119          fieldsWithAnnotation.add(new FieldWithAnnotation<>(field, annotation));
120        }
121
122      }
123
124      type = type.getSuperclass();
125    }
126
127    fieldsWithAnnotation = unmodifiableList(fieldsWithAnnotation);
128    FIELDS_WITH_ANNOTATION_CACHE.put(cacheKey, fieldsWithAnnotation);
129    return fieldsWithAnnotation;
130  }
131
132  /**
133   * Finds methods on the given {@code type} and all of its superclasses annotated with annotations of type
134   * {@code annotationType}.
135   * <p>
136   * These results are cached to mitigate performance overhead.
137   * 
138   * @param <T>
139   *          The annotation type.
140   * @param type
141   *          The target type token.
142   * @param annotationType
143   *          The annotation type token.
144   * @return A list of methods with the given annotation.
145   * @since 1.6.11
146   */
147  public static <T extends Annotation> List<Method> findMethodsWithAnnotation(Class<?> type, Class<T> annotationType) {
148    ClassAnnotationCacheKey cacheKey = new ClassAnnotationCacheKey(type, annotationType);
149    List<Method> cachedResults = METHODS_WITH_ANNOTATION_CACHE.get(cacheKey);
150
151    if (cachedResults != null) {
152      return cachedResults;
153    }
154
155    List<Method> methodsWithAnnotation = new ArrayList<>();
156
157    // Walk all superclasses looking for annotated methods until we hit Object
158    while (!Object.class.equals(type)) {
159      for (Method method : type.getDeclaredMethods()) {
160        T annotation = method.getAnnotation(annotationType);
161
162        if (annotation != null) {
163          methodsWithAnnotation.add(method);
164        }
165      }
166
167      type = type.getSuperclass();
168    }
169
170    methodsWithAnnotation = unmodifiableList(methodsWithAnnotation);
171    METHODS_WITH_ANNOTATION_CACHE.put(cacheKey, methodsWithAnnotation);
172    return methodsWithAnnotation;
173  }
174
175  /**
176   * For a given {@code field}, get its first parameterized type argument.
177   * <p>
178   * For example, a field of type {@code List<Long>} would have a first type argument of {@code Long.class}.
179   * <p>
180   * If the field has no type arguments, {@code null} is returned.
181   * 
182   * @param field
183   *          The field to check.
184   * @return The field's first parameterized type argument, or {@code null} if none exists.
185   */
186  public static Class<?> getFirstParameterizedTypeArgument(Field field) {
187    return getParameterizedTypeArgument(field, 0);
188  }
189
190  /**
191   * For a given {@code field}, get its second parameterized type argument.
192   *
193   * If the field has no type arguments, {@code null} is returned.
194   *
195   * @param field
196   *          The field to check.
197   * @return The field's second parameterized type argument, or {@code null} if none exists.
198   */
199  public static Class<?> getSecondParameterizedTypeArgument(Field field) {
200    return getParameterizedTypeArgument(field, 1);
201  }
202
203  private static Class<?> getParameterizedTypeArgument(Field field, int i) {
204    Type type = field.getGenericType();
205    if (!(type instanceof ParameterizedType)) {
206      return null;
207    }
208
209    ParameterizedType parameterizedType = (ParameterizedType) type;
210    Type firstTypeArgument = parameterizedType.getActualTypeArguments()[i];
211    return (firstTypeArgument instanceof Class) ? (Class<?>) firstTypeArgument : null;
212  }
213
214  /**
215   * Gets all accessor methods for the given {@code clazz}.
216   * 
217   * @param clazz
218   *          The class for which accessors are extracted.
219   * @return All accessor methods for the given {@code clazz}.
220   */
221  public static List<Method> getAccessors(Class<?> clazz) {
222    ObjectUtil.requireNotNull(clazz, () -> new IllegalArgumentException("The 'clazz' parameter cannot be null."));
223
224    List<Method> methods = new ArrayList<>();
225    for (Method method : clazz.getMethods()) {
226      String methodName = method.getName();
227      if (!"getClass".equals(methodName) && !"hashCode".equals(methodName) && method.getReturnType() != null
228          && !Void.class.equals(method.getReturnType()) && method.getParameterTypes().length == 0
229          && ((methodName.startsWith("get") && methodName.length() > 3)
230              || (methodName.startsWith("is") && methodName.length() > 2)
231              || (methodName.startsWith("has") && methodName.length() > 3))) {
232        methods.add(method);
233      }
234    }
235
236    methods.sort(Comparator.comparing(Method::getName));
237
238    return unmodifiableList(methods);
239  }
240
241  /**
242   * Reflection-based implementation of {@link Object#toString()}.
243   * 
244   * @param object
245   *          The object to convert to a string representation.
246   * @return A string representation of {@code object}.
247   * @throws IllegalStateException
248   *           If an error occurs while performing reflection operations.
249   */
250  public static String toString(Object object) {
251    StringBuilder buffer = new StringBuilder(object.getClass().getSimpleName());
252    buffer.append("[");
253
254    boolean first = true;
255
256    for (Method method : getAccessors(object.getClass())) {
257      if (first) {
258        first = false;
259      } else {
260        buffer.append(" ");
261      }
262
263      try {
264        String methodName = method.getName();
265        int offset = methodName.startsWith("is") ? 2 : 3;
266        methodName = methodName.substring(offset, offset + 1).toLowerCase() + methodName.substring(offset + 1);
267
268        buffer.append(methodName);
269        buffer.append("=");
270
271        if (!method.isAccessible()) {
272          method.setAccessible(true);
273        }
274
275        // Accessors are guaranteed to take no parameters and return a value
276        buffer.append(method.invoke(object));
277      } catch (Exception e) {
278        throwStateException(method, object.getClass(), e);
279      }
280    }
281
282    buffer.append("]");
283    return buffer.toString();
284  }
285
286  /**
287   * Reflection-based implementation of {@link Object#hashCode()}.
288   * 
289   * @param object
290   *          The object to hash.
291   * @return A hashcode for {@code object}.
292   * @throws IllegalStateException
293   *           If an error occurs while performing reflection operations.
294   */
295  public static int hashCode(Object object) {
296    if (object == null) {
297      return 0;
298    }
299
300    int hashCode = 17;
301
302    for (Method method : getAccessors(object.getClass())) {
303      try {
304        if (!method.isAccessible()) {
305          method.setAccessible(true);
306        }
307
308        Object result = method.invoke(object);
309        if (result != null) {
310          hashCode = hashCode * 31 + result.hashCode();
311        }
312      } catch (Exception e) {
313        throwStateException(method, object, e);
314      }
315    }
316
317    return hashCode;
318  }
319
320  /**
321   * Reflection-based implementation of {@link Object#equals(Object)}.
322   * 
323   * @param object1
324   *          One object to compare.
325   * @param object2
326   *          Another object to compare.
327   * @return {@code true} if the objects are equal, {@code false} otherwise.
328   * @throws IllegalStateException
329   *           If an error occurs while performing reflection operations.
330   */
331  public static boolean equals(Object object1, Object object2) {
332    if (object1 == null && object2 == null) {
333      return true;
334    }
335    if (!(object1 != null && object2 != null)) {
336      return false;
337    }
338
339    // Bail if the classes aren't at least one-way assignable to each other
340    if (!(object1.getClass().isInstance(object2) || object2.getClass().isInstance(object1))) {
341      return false;
342    }
343
344    // Only compare accessors that are present in both classes
345    Set<Method> accessorMethodsIntersection = new HashSet<>(getAccessors(object1.getClass()));
346    accessorMethodsIntersection.retainAll(getAccessors(object2.getClass()));
347
348    for (Method method : accessorMethodsIntersection) {
349      try {
350        if (!method.isAccessible()) {
351          method.setAccessible(true);
352        }
353
354        Object result1 = method.invoke(object1);
355        Object result2 = method.invoke(object2);
356        if (result1 == null && result2 == null) {
357          continue;
358        }
359        if (!(result1 != null && result2 != null)) {
360          return false;
361        }
362        if (!result1.equals(result2)) {
363          return false;
364        }
365      } catch (Exception e) {
366        throwStateException(method, null, e);
367      }
368    }
369
370    return true;
371  }
372
373  /**
374   * Creates a new instance of the given {@code type}.
375   * <p>
376   *
377   *
378   * @param <T>
379   *          Java type to map to.
380   * @param type
381   *          Type token.
382   * @return A new instance of {@code type}.
383   * @throws FacebookJsonMappingException
384   *           If an error occurs when creating a new instance ({@code type} is inaccessible, doesn't have a no-arg
385   *           constructor, etc.)
386   */
387  public static <T> T createInstance(Class<T> type) {
388    String errorMessage = "Unable to create an instance of " + type
389            + ". Please make sure that if it's a nested class, is marked 'static'. "
390            + "It should have a no-argument constructor.";
391
392    try {
393      Constructor<T> defaultConstructor = type.getDeclaredConstructor();
394      ObjectUtil.requireNotNull(defaultConstructor, () -> new FacebookJsonMappingException("Unable to find a default constructor for " + type));
395
396      // Allows protected, private, and package-private constructors to be
397      // invoked
398      defaultConstructor.setAccessible(true);
399      return defaultConstructor.newInstance();
400    } catch (Exception e) {
401      throw new FacebookJsonMappingException(errorMessage, e);
402    }
403  }
404
405  private static void throwStateException(Method method, Object obj, Exception e) {
406    throw new IllegalStateException("Unable to reflectively invoke " + method + Optional.ofNullable(obj).map(o -> " on " + o).orElse(""), e);
407  }
408
409  /**
410   * A field/annotation pair.
411   * 
412   * @author <a href="http://restfb.com">Mark Allen</a>
413   */
414  public static class FieldWithAnnotation<T extends Annotation> {
415    /**
416     * A field.
417     */
418    private final Field field;
419
420    /**
421     * An annotation on the field.
422     */
423    private final T annotation;
424
425    /**
426     * Creates a field/annotation pair.
427     * 
428     * @param field
429     *          A field.
430     * @param annotation
431     *          An annotation on the field.
432     */
433    public FieldWithAnnotation(Field field, T annotation) {
434      this.field = field;
435      this.annotation = annotation;
436    }
437
438    /**
439     * Gets the field.
440     * 
441     * @return The field.
442     */
443    public Field getField() {
444      return field;
445    }
446
447    /**
448     * Gets the annotation on the field.
449     * 
450     * @return The annotation on the field.
451     */
452    public T getAnnotation() {
453      return annotation;
454    }
455
456    @Override
457    public String toString() {
458      return format("Field %s.%s (%s): %s", field.getDeclaringClass().getName(), field.getName(), field.getType(),
459        annotation);
460    }
461  }
462
463  /**
464   * Cache key composed of a class and annotation pair. Used by {@link ReflectionUtils#FIELDS_WITH_ANNOTATION_CACHE}.
465   * 
466   * @author Igor Kabiljo
467   */
468  private static final class ClassAnnotationCacheKey {
469    /**
470     * Class component of this cache key.
471     */
472    private final Class<?> clazz;
473
474    /**
475     * Annotation component of this cache key.
476     */
477    private final Class<? extends Annotation> annotation;
478
479    /**
480     * Creates a cache key with the given {@code clazz}/@{code annotation} pair.
481     * 
482     * @param clazz
483     *          Class component of this cache key.
484     * @param annotation
485     *          Annotation component of this cache key.
486     */
487    private ClassAnnotationCacheKey(Class<?> clazz, Class<? extends Annotation> annotation) {
488      this.clazz = clazz;
489      this.annotation = annotation;
490    }
491
492    /**
493     * @see java.lang.Object#hashCode()
494     */
495    @Override
496    public int hashCode() {
497      final int prime = 31;
498      int result = 1;
499      result = prime * result + (annotation == null ? 0 : annotation.hashCode());
500      result = prime * result + (clazz == null ? 0 : clazz.hashCode());
501      return result;
502    }
503
504    /**
505     * @see java.lang.Object#equals(java.lang.Object)
506     */
507    @Override
508    public boolean equals(Object obj) {
509      if (this == obj) {
510        return true;
511      }
512      if (obj == null) {
513        return false;
514      }
515      if (getClass() != obj.getClass()) {
516        return false;
517      }
518
519      ClassAnnotationCacheKey other = (ClassAnnotationCacheKey) obj;
520
521      if (annotation == null) {
522        if (other.annotation != null) {
523          return false;
524        }
525      } else if (!annotation.equals(other.annotation)) {
526        return false;
527      }
528
529      if (clazz == null) {
530        return other.clazz == null;
531      } else return clazz.equals(other.clazz);
532    }
533  }
534}
